meanings.definition: To judge or determine the significance, worth, or quality of something.
meanings.sent1: She is evaluating the new painting in the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is evaluating the students' essays to give feedback.
meanings.sent3: While evaluating the cake, she accidentally dropped it on the floor.
meanings.sent4: He was evaluating the situation like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was carefully evaluating the data to draw conclusions.

meanings.definition: To assess or analyze something systematically.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic is evaluating the car engine for any issues.
meanings.sent2: The company is evaluating the market trends before launching a new product.
meanings.sent3: While evaluating the puzzle, she mixed up all the pieces.
meanings.sent4: She was evaluating the financial report like a skilled accountant.
meanings.sent5: The detective was meticulously evaluating the evidence to solve the case.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion or make a decision after careful consideration.
meanings.sent1: They are evaluating which movie to watch this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The committee is evaluating the proposals before selecting the best one.
meanings.sent3: While evaluating the book, she accidentally tore a page.
meanings.sent4: He was evaluating the options like a chess player planning his moves.
meanings.sent5: The judge was impartially evaluating the arguments presented in court.
